summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein discussing a financial dispute involving JPMorgan Chase and other individuals. Epstein expresses concerns about a meeting involving Wendall, Sussman, and Glenn, highlighting issues related to financial transactions and legal obligations. The email reflects Epstein's desire to resolve the matter without litigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email, discussing a financial dispute and expressing his views on the matter.

persons.name: Mary E. Erdoes
persons.context: Erdoes is one of the recipients of the email, indicating her involvement in the financial discussions.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is another recipient of the email, suggesting his role in the financial matters being discussed.

persons.name: Wendall
persons.context: Wendall is mentioned as someone who should recall a meeting related to the financial dispute.

persons.name: Sussman
persons.context: Sussman is mentioned in the context of a meeting with Wendall and Glenn regarding the financial issues.

persons.name: Glenn
persons.context: Glenn is mentioned as being adamant about the financial issues discussed in the meeting.

persons.name: Condren
persons.context: Condren is mentioned in relation to the valuation of Epstein's claims against JPMorgan Chase.

connections.description: Epstein communicates with Erdoes regarding legal matters and financial disputes.
Epstein includes Staley in discussions about financial issues and disputes.
Wendall and Glenn attended a meeting where financial issues were discussed.
Glenn and Sussman were present during discussions about the financial dispute.
Epstein discusses his claims and potential legal actions with Condren.

keyFacts: Epstein discusses a financial dispute involving JPMorgan Chase and expresses a desire to resolve it without litigation.
Glenn was adamant about the financial issues during a meeting with Wendall and Sussman.
The email indicates that there are legal versus moral duty considerations in the financial dispute.
Epstein mentions a previous oral redemption request and a written demand related to the financial issues.
There are references to a meeting involving Schulte, which is related to the investigation of the financial problem.
